app/database/models/process.py.description: Process management models created with 10 SQLAlchemy models: ProcessVersion, ProcessCommitment, ProcessNodeType, ProcessNode, ProcessFlowEdge, ProcessPrompt, PromptPackTemplate, PromptPackPrompt, ProcessSection, SectionPrompt. All use UUID primary keys, JSONB columns for flexible data, and proper relationships with back_populates.

app/database/models/storyteller.py.description: Storyteller and Life Event models created with 12 SQLAlchemy models. Key patterns: one-to-one relationships use uselist=False, ARRAY(Text) for text arrays, self-referential FKs in LifeEventPreference.merge_with_other_event_id. Storyteller is the root with life_events as children. LifeEvent has 8 child tables for timespans, locations, participants, details, trauma, boundary, media, and preferences.

app/database/models/session_models.py.description: Session models created with 12 SQLAlchemy models: StorytellerSession (renamed from Session to avoid conflict with app/database/session.py), SessionScope, SessionProfile, SessionProgress, SessionSectionStatus, SessionSynthesis, SessionArchetype, SessionLifeEvent, SessionInteraction, SessionArtifact, SessionTemplate, SessionNote. Key patterns: one-to-one relationships use uselist=False, UniqueConstraint for composite unique keys, proper indexes defined after class definitions.

app/database/models/collection.py.description: Collection models created with 7 SQLAlchemy models: Collection, CollectionLifeEvent, CollectionGrouping, CollectionGroupingMember, CollectionRelationship, CollectionTag, CollectionSynthesis. Key patterns: many-to-many relationships use join tables with UniqueConstraint, self-referential FKs for CollectionRelationship with source/target collections, ARRAY(Text) for synthesis_themes, proper back_populates on both sides of relationships.
